name: Nacho Cheese Beef Burgers
preparation: In a large mixing bowl, combine beef, Nacho Cheese Dip Seasoning, breadcrumbs, Burgers Seasoning, and egg.

Use your hands to thoroughly mix the ingredients. The mixture should hold together well, but not be sticky. Chill mixture in fridge for 15 minutes. Divide mixture into 4 one-quarter lb (113 g) portions (try using Epicure Burger Press).
Heat frying pan over medium-low heat. Cook each patty 4–6 minutes per side (flip patties, then top with mozzarella), until no longer pink in centre and the patties are slightly browned.
Spread your choice of condiment on buns and top with lettuce, onion or tomato.
tips: Try these burgers with Epicure Sweet & Spicy Mustard. Make extra and freeze for easy dinners next week.

products.name: Burger Seasoning
summary: Tired of bland burgers? Level up with one simple seasoning that’s packed with the robust flavours of onion, garlic, and red bell pepper, and a mild paprika kick. Just combine the seasoning with ground beef, chicken, pork, or turkey for mouth-watering burgers every single time.

products.name: 3-in-1 Burger Press
summary: Press perfectly shaped patties, stuffed burgers, and sliders with this non-stick 3-in-1 Burger Press. A great addition to a build-your-own-burger bar, switch up the protein – try beef, chicken, turkey, salmon, or veg – and fillings to make your burger your way!

products.name: Sweet & Spicy Organic Mustard
summary: Golden, sweet, with just the right heat. You’ll love this on burgers and Nashville Hot Chicken Sandwiches—or as a dip for chicken fingers. It’s also amazing in potato salad and salad dressings.
